adjective.description: Of a pig: that has had a knife thrust into its neck; stuck. Chiefly in similative phrases. Compare "stuck". Now rare (chiefly British regional in later use).

origin: Middle English; earliest use found in Otuel. From stick + -ed<br>early 18th century; earliest use found in Samuel Sewall (1652–1730), judge and diarist in America. From stick + -ed<br>late 18th century; earliest use found in Tench Coxe (1755–1824). From stick + -ed.
